storyInfo: Mandragora, as the head of Dublinn readying to leave for the meeting, receives news that its location has been leaked. Bagpipe and Horn infiltrate, and are conversing with a bard when they find themselves surrounded by troops, led by the colonel.

attributes.content: Honorable lady, I'm most privileged to inform you, the dinner party is all ready—
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: So slow. You aristocrats, taking your sweet time with everything you do. You're a nightmare.
...It was my inadequate reception. Please, permit that I express to you my most sincere apologies.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: You can save your breath. How many will be coming today, exactly?
All of County Hillock's fine minds have received the invitation, including our most widely celebrated bard as of recent, Seamus Williams...
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Bard? I'm bored dead already. What about the nobles and merchants you promised to find?
Of course... of course, they'll all be coming too.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: For example, the leader within the south region's textiles industry, Sir Paulet, recipient of the McCaughey Prize, Dr. Bashir, and the owner of more than ten steelworks, Mr. Evans...
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Oh? These people you mention, especially that last one, they're definitely coming?
Yes, and a portion of them have already arrived.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: I hear a most honorable guest has turned up, and quite a few celebrity intellects from other cities have come flocking too, all for a single glimpse of you and your compatriots' presence.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Oh, yes, as per your request, I've drawn up this list of names, for your perusal whenever you should—
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Bit too many words, but you've done good enough work. Alright, you can head off now.
Deeply grateful for your generous praise. Once you're ready, please, inform me. I simply cannot wait to see this ordinary little parlor of mine be dazzlingly belightened by your arrival.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Why are you still here? Weren't you done talking?
Ahem, please allow me to ask one last question—that most honorable lady there, have we even the sliver of a chance that she may alight on the venue too?
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: That's not yours to ask. Clear off.
Mandragora, what has you feeling all flustered?
Less of that—tongue-in-cheek, giving me reflux. We all know you'd never really give a shit about anyone, Harmonie.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Siiigh. Then I'll have to put it another way—you've been blocking my light with your halfwit ambling. I'd like to finish reading this lovely novel, dear.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Tch.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Are all of you rich people like this?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Hang instruments up a wall, buy a few books, act like you're filling the windows so nobody notices how you've got nothing at all in your head.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I'll take having a window to fill over having nothing of anything inside or out, wouldn't you say?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You—!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Now, now. You're not happy to calm down for a while, I see. How about this? If which foot forward first bothers you so much in this ball you know nothing about, I can be your lead for the dance.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: What complete shit are you on about?!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I'm thinking of bigger things. With this many nobles and merchants coming, if we can get their support, then forget just occupying one scant little Hillock, we could snatch the whole of Londinium—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Mandragora, time to hold still.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: At this point, can't you just let that grotty book of yours go? Do you even think for one second about anything important to The Leader or me?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I'm not saying anything about your oh-so-helpless gait. I'm saying, take your rollercoaster babble and hold it still, and all that absurdity you're exhausting your little brain with too.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: You, telling me to hold it now? As if I could! Laying out and assigning roles, swallowing my sick to set this meeting up, how much of me do you think I've poured out for this plan?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: I couldn't wait since forever ago! I can't wait! For Dublinn's fires to burn this city through, rip this lie of a titan under our feet apart!
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: And you, huh? You and that shameless fake taking what should be the glory of The Leader—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: It is really, really, time for you to shut up now.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: At what point—was your job to make decisions for The Leader?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Tch—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Mm, it's me. Yes, we're still here.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Things have gotten a little interesting at long last.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Seems we've no need to scrap in here about whether your little schemes of insolence are feasible or not.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Is it news from that bastard?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Someone's sniffed out this location. I've a feeling it'll be more than your friendly little invitees coming to the meeting tonight.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: ...People from the army?
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: More or less. My, my, maybe some of my acquaintances too.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Tch. God on high, I want to—
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Put away your staff. You'll get your chance. But it won't be now.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: It's time we go, we've got other things to do. Leave it to her in here; we might be in for a good show before we know it.
attributes.name: Harmonie

attributes.content: Heheh... I was starting to fantasize about how it'd look if this horrible room broke down into slag.
attributes.name: Mandragora

attributes.content: Leader, I didn't imagine slippin' in would be as easy as this. Here I thought...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We'd have to find a way to infiltrate? Not out of the question. That said, go in the proper way, and it's more convenient to find a conversation partner.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Guess my friend at the barracks got some real precious information. Can't be that many who know about this meeting.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: A lot of secret aristocrat parties are held this way—they usually think of invitation letters as passé.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: So long as you have a channel to tap for info, plus a token as proof of identity, you have what you need to pass the doorstep.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You never told me your family was all big famous nobility.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Does it make a difference?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: When I was in school, the noble students always stuck with their own. Course, they studied together, but after school, they never did much with the rest of us if they could help it.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Don't tell me you actually like all the pomp and formality? Ceremonial gowns you only wear once, the trending look changing every week, courtesy greetings ad nauseum.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Don't even remind me. Actually went to that kind of thing once or twice with a good friend, and just tryin' to remember which fork you use to eat first made my head want to explode on the spot.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Perfect, I'm not much of a fan either.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Even if I'm loath to admit it, just having this family name does come in handy once in a while.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader, the people comin' here today, are they all supporters of the spectre force?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...I don't necessarily think so.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Mr. Williams, I finally get to meet you! I heard you were coming, and came bolting right over from County Peninsula, just to ask if you could sign the anthology in my collection here.
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Of course, fine Lady, it would be my honor.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Seamus, my dearest great bard! Here you were.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: I just finished reading your newly published tales from history. Such fascinating writings. It was the first I learned that us Tarans had such a grand, storied past.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Thank you, but they're works of fantasy, adapted from an array of folk legends. The greatest value in my work is simply unearthing gems buried by sandstorms, all the better for more to see.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: You truly are too modest. The Draco King Gaeil you penned, founding by himself the most radiant culture that was Tara—he stood grand and wise, so much so that my dreams are flush with emotion and he's part of them all—
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Yes, too true. In my eyes, you're alike to Leithanien's grand musicians, with the chance to make change to an entire era!
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Ha, ha... I must say you exaggerate.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: So long as you wanted, all of Victoria's publishers would be wide open to you, every one of them waiting to translate your works into the ink of different languages.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: And when that happens, every country across the land will realize our Taran culture has its own unique charm, not to be stifled by the ever-same grumble of Victoria's machines.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: If only things could be so wonderful. If more and more international figures come to support us, our voices will be so much more easily heard by the dukedom and Parliament.
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Right you are! I'm a Victorian citizen same as anyone else, but just because some great-great-great-grandfather of mine was King Gaeil's subject, suddenly I'm being asked to pay so much more inheritance tax! How preposterous!
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Even so, Mr. Evans, you still give vigorous employ to plenty enough of our fellows, providing everyone the chance to gain their footing upon this city of grace.
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: No wonder you and your clan are the pride of us Tarans.
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Ahah, quite right, our fellows. It's far from easy for them to find any respectable work. I hear they toil in the factories for a week, and only earn yea little coin.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: Yet Victorian workers from other backgrounds are able to earn twice as much, in your factories.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Eh-hem...
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Allow me to say something perhaps a little out of fashion—it's far from simple to have our neighbors of strength acknowledge us, isn't it?
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Please, think about it, everyone. Were it only with its music and poems, how could Leithanien become the Leithanien of today?
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Just as Leithanien has Casters that intimidate—
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: We Tarans must depend on more practical power if we want to gain recognition. Such as the... technological support of some friends from far away.
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: And by pure luck, I have just the tiniest means by which I receive sponsorship, and I would be overjoyed to take the opportunity to let the friends of the Baron share in it.
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Hahah, you're absolutely spot-on! Any subsidy is of great importance. If you let it all pass you by, then no matter how deft your tongue, you watch for the day it dries up and lacks the power to express.
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: From that perspective, I'm the same as everyone here. We are all yearning for a whole new era—so, why not give a toast to this common dream of ours?
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Truly, an evening to inspire... how strange, where did Mr. Williams get off to?
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Good evening, Mr. Williams.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Greetings, ma'am.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I hope I'm not bothering you. Are you writing?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ha, ha... Just a small poem. It's been several days now, and I still haven't finished it.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I was thinking this meeting would give me some inspiration, but it seems now there's still no forcing the muse.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: These settings always like to use up a person's energy too quickly. Do you also feel a little worn out?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ha-ha... caught red-handed. If it weren't for Charles—I mean, the Baron inviting me so ardently, I would've preferred to spend the night reading by my own fireplace.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Wouldn't we all? I bet every person willing to participate in this sort of thing is forced to for a living.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I like that way of putting it. You're not a Taran, ma'am, are you?
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: You guess correctly. I imagine a Lupo's a rare sight among the residents here.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ha-ha, I've inadvertently judged background by race.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Though you're deliberately choosing vocabulary we're more used to, your accent still exposes you—it's the accent only a Victorian noble receiving a standard Londinium education would have.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: No wonder you're a great bard. Extremely sharp.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The first step to writing is observation. I can even tell, you and they have differing purposes for coming.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: You're suspecting me?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Suspecting what? I'm only here to exchange some ideas, and you're exchanging with me right now.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: No matter if I'm not a Taran?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Precisely because you're not.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: A glass of malt liquor, thank you—would you like anything to drink, ma'am?
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I'll be fine. Standing in the window breeze is plenty enough for me.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Then we'll continue our merry chat. What were we just saying?
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Right, yes. Words and writing were born for the purpose of exchange, including both conversations past and future, and this talk between you and I, here and now.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: You're the one allowing for me. If you used Taran, I'd be as good as deaf.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ha-ha—in this party, you'll be hard-pressed to hear any Taran.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: It just clicked for me, actually. All the works of yours I've read are written in Victorian.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Rhyming confines a poet's imagination. Characteristically, Victoria's poems, when you read them, are very unlike Leithanien's.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I much love reading poems written in Old Taran. Reading the writing is like touching upon, feeling another face of history.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: But I've no plans to pass myself off as anything.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I grew up speaking Victorian, my thoughts are molded by the language, and if I started to write in Taran instead, I'd be a clown dancing in shoes far too big for him.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I hear there are many longing for the revival of Taran culture—
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Of course, I'm one of them.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Our city roams upon the land, this soil unchanging, yet at the same time, change constantly happening.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: Perhaps a day will come when Taran once again becomes the building blocks of our children's minds, and I'd be willing to embrace such a transformation.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: And if—there were those who wished this change to be rapid, an explosion even reversive of the natural trend?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: 'What is the use of an idea? You are planting a feather in the ground, imagining it growing into a fowlbeast.'
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: From the first poetry anthology you published. It's one of my particular favorites.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: That is my answer to this question of yours.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: In my own view, I can't, and have no thought to alter this soil. I'm simply the one trying hard to plant feathers.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: And ideas fundamentally ought to be free, with no one who can interfere—each feather that grows in each person's heart may be totally unalike, just as we all have different hopes for the future of this great swathe of soil.
attributes.name: Bard Williams

attributes.content: I understand, Mr. Williams.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Allow me to speak from the heart—it's been truly pleasant to chat with you.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Leader, somethin's not right.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What is it?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Cello's lot have gone over forty minutes without sendin' anythin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Weren't they meant to be dealin' with the troops at the barracks? You told them they were to send a message every half hour. Right as we set off, Cello was even gripin' at me how this mission was too borin'.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: And on top of that... don't you feel it's a little too quiet all around?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I've been keepin' watch at the window. Ought to be able to see people goin' in and out of the plaza. But then all of a sudden, it was like somethin' happened, and everyone scarpered away.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Don't tell me... the ones tailing us before were the barracks'...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The ballroom doors are kicked open without warning.
Dozens of soldiers armed to the teeth come charging in.
Good heavens, what's happening? Why the sudden show of force?
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: You have the audacity to point weapons at me... do you understand who we are?
attributes.name: Pretentious Noblewoman

attributes.content: Who is it? Who let the secret out?!
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: Damn and blast... we need to get out of here, quick!
attributes.name: Greedy Businessman

attributes.content: (Hurry, go inform Madam Mandragora, just say we've got trouble...)
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: (What?! You mean they're all gone? When did this happen? A whole hour ago?!)
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: (You useless...!)
attributes.name: Wildly Ambitious Baron

attributes.content: All of you, stay where you are!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier

attributes.content: Ladies and gentlemen, yes, no mistake, you have been—utterly captured.
attributes.name: Colonel Hamilton
